item.description:
Please RSVP!  This is a special two part two day Meetup on consecutive days – Wednesday, January 25 AND Thursday, January 26.  There is about 5 hours worth of material here and rather than shortchange you or the speaker, we are dividing it into two parts.  Both will start at 7pm and end around 10.  I am only putting up one announcement for simplicity sake.

Speaker: Konstantin Litovsky

Title: Prudent Investment Management: Myths, Realities and Implications for Investors.

Recent economic turmoil has left many with large investment losses. While nobody can predict the magnitude and the timing of the next crash, you can be better prepared if the right steps are taken to protect your portfolio from hidden risk. We will explore the myths and realities of today's investment world with an emphasis on how to avoid getting hurt by the hidden risk in the stock market. We will also develop a practical set of rules for managing risk in personal finance. This class was inspired by Nassim Taleb’s book, “The Black Swan: The Impact of the Highly Improbable.”

Background Materials for the class:

 http://litovskymanagement.com/2011/09/prudent-investment-management

Powerpoint Slides will be available the day after the presentation.

Some of the Topics Covered:

  • Normal vs. Scalable
  • Modern Portfolio Theory
  • Looking at Economic Data
  • Scalable Stock Market Fundamentals
  • Myths and Facts
  • Why investors fail
  • Portfolio management and hidden risk
  • Why diversification fails
  • Rules of prudent investment management

 

Instructor Bio

Konstantin Litovsky is the owner and principal at Litovsky Asset Management, a fee-only Financial Planning and Money Management firm based in Newton. His background is in Electrical Engineering and Mathematics, and he worked for 9 years as a Systems Engineer in the Defense industry.  His interests include mathematical finance and its application to portfolio risk management with the goal of helping investors manage hidden risks in their portfolios.

 

Pre-Meeting: 

In anticipation of our February 4 Meeting featuring John Locke discussing Trading Options Butterflies for Income, BIG member David Lothrop will present an introduction to options butterflies at 6:00 Wednesday, January 25, before the regular BIG meeting at 7:00.

 

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google.com/bostonibd
or send email to Jeff Orrik at orrik@comcast.net

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
